Author: B. G√ºltekin √áetiner#0626
Content: It is a trust based linking system shifting the trust from the first issuer to endorser. Then circulates between pairs of two sides who always trust the previous ones. Names of credit issuers are known to each other. It happens in business. They stamp on papers and put slgnatures.

Author: B. G√ºltekin √áetiner#0626
Content: There are more. If there is not enough fund, the second node in the link is responsible. All nodes from top to bottom are responsible. They are visited and their funds are used to redeem. There is also 5% blockage for issuing a credit. And finally the 10% fund is used to clear. If the link fails they are all blacklisted especially the first node.

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content:
`Suppose I sell furniture worth 10k lira and you have no money except MARMARA immature coins. You write a post-dated cheque or create a credit with a future date on say 1 july 2019 worth of And you have immature coins spendable only after 1 july 2019 worth of 10k liras in MARMARA. There will be names on the system but even if I don't know you, I will sell this refrigerator to you without hesitation because of your immature coins after post-date.`
That's nice of you to give me $2k USD worth of furniture on credit, but what will you have in place to stop me from putting my mature MARMARA coins in a z_addy on 1 july 2019 and you never see the coins or your furniture again?

Author: B. G√ºltekin √áetiner#0626
Content:
I thank very much @jl777c on behalf of Marmara community for opening the important issue for delivering timelocked coins to miners. As you know, we will have a policy of timelocking the coins indefinitely in Marmara. Since timelocked coins are a must to solve the non-redemption problem in credit creation, we will always have coins with timelocks in coinbase ranging from 3 months to 2 years. This makes mining in pools a great problem. So the coinbase CC will solve this problem. It will be really a great innovation in Blockchain. By this way, we will be able to decentralize the credit creation of post-dated cheques and promissory notes in Turkey with at least 200 billion USD market size. 
https://github.com/Mixa84/To-Do/issues/6 @hellcatz @dukeleto

Author: B. G√ºltekin √áetiner#0626
Content:
Deutsche Bank declares blockchain currencies as a failure and tries to blur the potential of blockchains. But there is one simple fact they are hiding successfully: It is creation of money by banks as credit. Majority of money is created as credit by banks out of thin air. And this may be decentralized completely and could happen in real economy as in Post-dated cheques and promissory notes example in Turkey. Credit creation by masses in a decentralized way without banks will be a real challenging thing to their surprise. 
https://www.dbresearch.com/PROD/RPS_EN-PROD/PROD0000000000483768/The_multiple_stages_of_the_blockchain_revolution_%E2%80%93.pdf

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@B. G√ºltekin √áetiner 
Please take a look at this article: https://hackernoon.com/why-everyone-missed-the-most-mind-blowing-feature-of-cryptocurrency-860c3f25f1fb

He says: "The true power of cryptocurrencies is the power to print and distribute money without a central power." and "You see, Satoshi understood the first part of the maxim, the power to print money. What he missed was the power to distribute that money." 

I think peer to peer credit creation and settlement might be the solution to the "decentralization of creation of money" problem. In the article, he goes on to talk about ways to do it, but its all very abstract and futuristic for now.

It might be a good idea to engage him about your ideas regarding peer-peer credit creation. He has some very good ideas and has a large following. https://twitter.com/dan_jeffries1
He has a podcast episode on the same topic: http://dailyposthuman.com/why-everyone-missed-the-most-mind-blowing-feature-of-cryptocurrency-2/

Author: B. G√ºltekin √áetiner#0626
Content: @gcharang Thanks very much. I read the article. There is a common misunderstanding about the reality of money creation by banks. Many people are confused by the theory of Fractional Reserve banking (FRB)  system. I was also confused until I read the "lost century in Economics" by Professor Richard Werner. The main cause for misunderstanding is the publications made by Fed. The major one is "modern money mechanics". In reality, it is much easier to understand. FRB is fictitious and problematic to explain banks as intermediary institutions. In reality, banks just create credits when giving loans without need of any relending. And majority of money in circulation (97%)  is created as credit. In my opinion, banking could not be replaced by Blockchain unless credit function is solved in better way than banking system.

Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
I went through the marmara rpc and docs.
I think the current implementation is almost clear to me.
There are some questions.
In our implementation issuers in a loop lock their money for future settlement.
But as I can see it, vadeli cheques allow to create payment means while issuer does not have money yet. He wants to create a debt and pay it when he earns some money.
But do we require he should have the money? And if holder receives the money in settlement when it matures how could he use it before?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @B. G√ºltekin √áetiner will have the answers

Author: B. G√ºltekin √áetiner#0626
Content: @dimxy In Version 2.0, no need to have activated or boosted coins during issuance. It is money creation. But in Version 1.0, the issuer should have 100 % of coins locked. When the marmarabatonapproval is done, the activated/locked coins are transferred to boosted.

Author: B. G√ºltekin √áetiner#0626
Content: In version 2.0, we will create credit as fiat currencies. It will be vadeli cheque (post-dated cheque) information on chain.

Author: B. G√ºltekin √áetiner#0626
Content: In Version 1.0, we do not create money and no there is no fiat. Why would anyone give credit then if he/she cannot create credit? Well! We rely on the ability to generate MUCH MORE coins with boosted staking when locked in credit loops.

Author: B. G√ºltekin √áetiner#0626
Content: 25% of coins are produced with mining. The remaining is through activated and boosted.

Author: B. G√ºltekin √áetiner#0626
Content:
There are three types of coins as normal, activated and boosted ones. Boosted has three times more chance to find blocks during staking than activated coins*. Btw, staking needs activated or boosted, i.e. locked coins. 
* "three times more chance" is to be confirmed by @jl777c

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 3x or any factor can be implemented

Author: B. G√ºltekin √áetiner#0626
Content: Is it parametric?

Author: B. G√ºltekin √áetiner#0626
Content: Or hardcoded?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: hardcoded, is much easier

Author: B. G√ºltekin √áetiner#0626
Content: Ok. 3x may be default.

Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
@B. G√ºltekin √áetiner hello,
I have several more questions:

Is \'settlement\' actually a cheque redemption, that is, when cheque holder enters a bank and requests cash in exchange of the cheque?

Do I understand it right that the main purpose of the currently implemented v1.0 (aka Millenium ed) is to check how the settlement of locked coins would work and how their owner would receive some benefits from their coins being locked?
But the functionality of credit issuance itself was just very much simplified (as it does not actually send any coins to holder when credit is issued)?
So it is not the real business case but rather technology studying?

From this article https://medium.com/@cemilturun/we-had-paper-blockchains-for-decades-13ac29c4efd0
I understand that only the first cheque issuer is the payer for it. The rest cirantas just bypass it to the next holder and they do not pay anything when the cheque payment day comes. 
In our implementation all endorsers might pay when settlement is going on. I was also told actually each endorser would garantee exactly 1/N fraction from the total credit value.
So is it some new advancement for the real vadeli cheques?
(Or, maybe real vadeli endorsers also would have to pay if any previous issuer defaulted?)

Why is it needed to have endorsers at all when vadeli cheques are passed to a next holder? Why not just pass it as a usual banknote and simply allow to bearer just go to a bank and convert it to cash after the cheque has matured? (maybe, endorsers should pay if the issuer defaults)

Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
The main idea is that an issuer could create a vadelie cheque not having money yet (in the hopes he will get the money later). So it seems, no need for him to lock his money.
(Also we spoke in the chat that issuers would not need to lock their money in the version 2.)
So, how is it supposed to use this locking feature in v2, who will use it? (maybe it is other roles who will be backing credits)

I have read some about lending loops in Canada where people make small deposits and this funding is used for short time loans for small businesses. We are not implementing this model (as it does not create money), yes?

(Sorry, if I missed anything in the docs)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there is a full spec for v2, probably that will help. with v1, it had 0% default rate and nothing very complex so it was decided to start with that to get things going

Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
Oh, yes, B. G√ºltekin √áetiner gave it to me, studying it.
(I'm a bit confused with v1.0 as it seems the model implemented in it does not match to the concept in that medium article)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: correct, it is a millenium modification

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the idea is that you only need 1/N capital tied up for a creditloop, where N is the number of participants. by incentivising participating in a creditloop, it shouldnt be hard to increase N.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so you do have to start with 50% (issuer and first), it is expected that soon there will be second, third, ... thus reducing the amount that is locked

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this is indeed different, but the advantage is 0% default as all creditloops are 100% secured with locked coins

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: granted it doesnt perform the money creation that an unsecured creditloop will, but I think once we make a 100% secured creditloop system working, going to a fractional reserve system should be a matter of changing an internal parameter

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: at that point it will be money creation as described, though it opens up the possibility of default and triggers the need for multiple layers of insurance, arbitration, etc.

Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
thank you for the explanation.
Is it correct to say that in v1.0 an issuer actually issues credit to himself and provides a collateral for it with time-locked funds?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: pretty close. but there is always the first reciepient to create the creditloop, so it is being issued to another pubkey

Author: dimxy#2587
Content: remembering of vadeli concept I would say the receipient just receives IOU of the issuer

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: oh, yes you are correct, the issuer is 100% backed at this point

Author: dimxy#2587
Content: So I would say an issuer creates a credit to himself, backs it 100% with time locked coins and uses this credit as legal tender to pay for goods provided by a recipient. The recipient, in turn, receives a sort of IOU in exchange for his goods and settles it when it matures.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with v1 idea is to extend the credit loop

Author: B. G√ºltekin √áetiner#0626
Content:
1. Yes. Settlement is actually cheque redemption at the date which is decided during issuance.
2. It is a real business even in Millennium edition (Version 1). Suppose I issue a credit of 600 MCL. When the first endorser (which is also holder) gets the baton, I buy goods and services for the amount of 600 MCL. But it does not leave my Wallet until redemption date. Furthermore, it is boosted so I get full power of staking. It is fully collateralized. At any stage, the zero defaulting occurs. However, as you discovered, the Version 1 is more miner friendly.
3. Yes, The millennium edition is simplified. The article explains the paper based analog chain Version of existing cultural system but Version 2 is a complete solution to nonredemption problem and other problems in paper version. 
4. In all versions, it works best with transfer of goods and services. But I admit that the Version 1.0 is more miner friendly since anyone can create to accounts and issue credit to himself/herself to use boosted staking. However, we want to spread Version 1 among community for exchange of real goods and services.

Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
Great! Thank you.
Now it is much more clearer to me

Author: dimxy#2587
Content: So the first task is to correct the settlement to provide equal distribution of debt payment between the issuers?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, and also managing the changing lock amounts as creditloop is getting bigger

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not sure the most efficient way. moving all funds into and out of credit loop locked addresses might be too much overhead

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: alternative is to track who owes how much, but it becomes hard to enforce the locked nature

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and there are two levels of locked funds, one is the normal locked where it can only be used for staking or creditloops

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then when it is in a creditloop, its staking power increases 3x

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the was to implement that is to change just one function deep in the staking code, that is solved how to do, so just ask when you are doing that part

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also current code has some definite bugs with settlement as that was coded before there was any clear idea of how exactly to make settlements

Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
Yes, it is what I actually was going to ask: now as I can see the marmara cc does not check if sufficient funds are locked by the issuer.
And probably it should not because it would be like the first issuer would already have the full amount backed.
From the other hand if we do not check this we could not say the credit is 100% backed.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, these are the issues that need to be solved

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with efficient methods

Author: B. G√ºltekin √áetiner#0626
Content: We will have the third layer, i.e. the blockchain fund in Version 1.0, too. It might be used to clear the dusts with transfer fees. We should not stop transfers for small fees in credit loop operations.

Author: B. G√ºltekin √áetiner#0626
Content: @dimxy You are right. Currently it does not check if sufficient funds are locked by issuer. This is because We did not have in mind millennium features where we have collateralization. This feature might be useful in Version 2 as well since We have new improvements with community layer.

Author: B. G√ºltekin √áetiner#0626
Content: The formula for risk share is same for all steps. It is Credit/(N-1). If there are 2 nodes in credit loop, the first is issuer and the second is holder. The issuer's 600 is locked in boosted. If there are 3 nodes, then 1st is issuer, the 2nd is endorser and 3rd is holder. So the credit risk is divided b/w issuer and endorser as 300. The issuer gets 300 back as normal coin while ensorser's 300 is locked first and then boosted when batonapproval happens. At each step, there is 100% collateralization.

Author: B. G√ºltekin √áetiner#0626
Content: All previous nodes are responsible against the holder at the end date of credit loop.
